result.execSummary:
The defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The court sentenced the defendant to 39 days in the HOC with credit for 39 days time served for a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.Civil rights suspended until reinstated.Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by collection from DOC in Case # 11CF3736.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clementhis Mark Lambert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Jennifer M Severino.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).    Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court sentenced defendant to serve 39 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 39 days served;  for a time served disposition.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge out of up 25% prison wages (to be collected by the DOC)  in 11CF3736, any balance as a condition of ES in that case.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA HEARING  commencing APRIL 8, 2014 received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Atty Jennifer Severino  524 Mail Street  Ste 202  Racine, WI  54303.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Jennifer M Severino.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-23-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Jennifer M Severino.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Attorney Eichenloaub
informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.   Court does not rule on the motion to withdraw guilty plea at this time.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: 14RM019162  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-08-2014 pg
All other conditions of bail remain the same.
Justice Point Report addressed; defendant is not in compiance with conditions of bail.  Court amends bail at this time.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Alexis Liggins (for Attorney Eichenlaub)  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Zachariah Fudge appeared under the  Student Practice Rule.      Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing being set on the 5th business day per request of District Attorney to accomadate off-groups.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Clementhis Mark Lambert in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
